text: In the final part of our tutorial we're going to talk about ways to optimize smoke liquid and fire effects. And the manner in which we're really going to primarily focus has to deal with taking our very complex fire smoke or liquid effects and baking them down into a series of images that can then be played back in real time to give the illusion that this really complex behavior is happening when in fact we are basically pre computing that behavior to a texture frame by frame and then playing it back. This is commonly called a flip book but here is what the texture would look like. So we'd start here at frame zero and we'd go eight by eight which give us sixty four. So this is it turning on and then going down and we get something. It's not video here but something like this that we can then play back. Now to do this inside of Niagara it's actually very simple. All we need to do is come up to the editor and the effect we want and enable the baker.
